avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger.
avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a strong wind from westerly directions, further wind slabs will form during the course of the night. In the course of the day they will increase in size once again. The avalanche prone locations are to be found on very steep slopes and on wind-loaded slopes, caution is to be exercised in particular along the border with France.

As a consequence of warming during the day more small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized dry and wet avalanches are to be expected below approximately 2200 m, in the event of prolonged bright spells especially.

Persistent weak layers. Weak layers in the old snowpack can still be released in very isolated cases by individual winter sport participants especially between approximately 2700 and 3000 m. These avalanche prone locations are barely recognisable, even to the trained eye, caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example.
Whumpfing sounds are a clear indication.

snowpackStructure.comment:
10 to 15 cm of snow fell during the night above approximately 1800 m. Up to 2300 m rain has fallen. The westerly wind has transported the new snow significantly. These weather conditions gave rise to unfavourable bonding of the old snowpack in some places in particular along the border with France below approximately 2500 m.
15 to 30 cm of snow will fall until Thursday above approximately 1500 m. The strong wind will transport the new snow.
The snowpack will be generally subject to considerable local variations. In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2000 m, depending on the infuence of the wind.

tendency.highlights: Wind and new snow: The avalanche danger will persist.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a sometimes strong wind from westerly directions, further wind slabs will form during the night at intermediate and high altitudes. In the course of the day they will increase in size moderately. The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and on extremely steep slopes.

More small moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2300 m, in particular on extremely steep slopes, in the event of prolonged bright spells especially.

snowpackStructure.comment:
5 to 10 cm of snow fell during the night above approximately 1800 m. The westerly wind has transported the new snow. The weather conditions on Wednesday gave rise to moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2300 m.
5 to 15 cm of snow will fall until Thursday above approximately 2000 m. The westerly wind will transport the new snow.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2000 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. At low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in extremely steep terrain at intermediate and high altitudes.
avalancheActivity.comment: The westerly wind will transport only a little snow. In particular at intermediate and high altitudes mostly shallow wind slabs will form. Caution is to be exercised on extremely steep slopes, especially at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example, in particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 2 (moderate). In these regions the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities up to 5 cm of snow will fall until Thursday above approximately 2000 m.
The snowpack will be generally subject to considerable local variations. In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER
